text:
This #MLKDay I'm excited to share with you my new podcast: Lift Every Voice.

My 1st guest is a civil rights icon who always gets into #goodtrouble & has a treasure trove of stories: @RepJohnLewis

Listen @ApplePodcasts: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/lift-every-voice/id1334991206?utm_content=buffer1efd9&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer & @Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/7pKgXwWONwaDffqlVFPYHf?utm_content=buffere8aac&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/952903340089802757/pu/img/AErcxRWQ96Cw9F5E.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/952903340089802757/pu/vid/288x320/oOJVvOx8AlxkutGb.mp4
Every valley shall be lifted up,every mountain & hill made low;The rugged land shall be a plain, the rough country,a broad valley. Is 40:4

Today we honor the life and legacy of Reverend Martin Luther King, Jr. Reverend King was a champion of the American creed: "We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal." https://www.facebook.com/tedcruzpage/photos/a.495661567463.299907.69983322463/10155903532387464/ #MLKDay http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTlwJ9HXUAAFQ-A.jpg

While America has made great strides on the road to racial equality, work remains to be done. As we honor the memory of Reverend King today, may we never forget our responsibility to pursue truth and justice as he did, and secure the blessings of liberty for every American.

As he courageously called on his fellow Americans, ‘to lift our nation from the quicksands of racial injustice to the solid rock of brotherhood,’ he inspired men and women from every corner of our nation.

In sharing his dream on the Lincoln Memorial steps, he urged America to honor its ‘sacred obligation’ and advocated for the unalienable right to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness for every American.
His devotion to truth and justice changed the course of history nearly 55 years ago, when he spoke out against the grotesque injustice of racial discrimination.

Today we honor the life and legacy of Reverend Martin Luther King, Jr. Reverend King was a champion of the American creed: ‘We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal.’ -> https://www.cruz.senate.gov/?p=press_release&id=3588 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTltzHAXkAEPDMr.jpg

RT @CoryBooker This #MLKDay I'm excited to share with you my new podcast: Lift Every Voice.

My 1st guest is a civil rights icon who always gets into #goodtrouble & has a treasure trove of stories: @RepJohnLewis

Listen @ApplePodcasts: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/lift-every-voice/id1334991206?utm_content=buffer1efd9&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer & @Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/7pKgXwWONwaDffqlVFPYHf?utm_content=buffere8aac&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/952903340089802757/pu/img/AErcxRWQ96Cw9F5E.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/952903340089802757/pu/vid/288x320/oOJVvOx8AlxkutGb.mp4

This #MLKDay I urge everyone to reflect on the principles that Martin Luther King Jr. peacefully defended so that as a nation we can continue to embody his dream of opportunity and equality for all. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTlpDzBXkAA2sU4.jpg

There will always be the laws of men. But #MartinLutherKing showed us that there is sometimes a higher calling, a duty to one’s nation and God that requires resisting conventional standards or laws.  https://m.washingtontimes.com/news/2013/aug/30/paul-extending-the-reach-of-kings-dream/

There will always be the laws of men. But #MartinLutherKing showed us that there is sometimes a higher calling, a duty to one’s nation and God that requires resisting conventional standards or laws.  https://m.washingtontimes.com/news/2013/aug/30/paul-extending-the-reach-of-kings-dream/
With this decision, UT has exemplified the mindset America’s academic institutions must adopt to counter the PRC’s influence operations.

Whereas similar programs have been lured by Tung Chee-hwa’s funding, the China Public Policy Center at UT-Austin recognized the risk partnering with the Communist Party of China poses to academic freedom & the robust exchange of ideas that are essential to the American university

I am deeply gratified with this decision by the University of Texas. UT-Austin has always been a leading voice in education and academics in Texas and around the world, and the University's judgment to reject funding and exchanges with CUSEF was prudent.->https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/global-opinions/university-rejects-chinese-communist-party-linked-influence-efforts-on-campus/2018/01/14/c454b54e-f7de-11e7-beb6-c8d48830c54d_story.html?utm_term=.66f4f9dfbc26

Thank you Congressman Lewis, you inspire me every day and especially today. https://twitter.com/repjohnlewis/status/952939042861142017 QT @repjohnlewis It was good to be with you, Sen Booker. Thank you for all of your work. https://twitter.com/corybooker/status/952903591869730816
“it is wrong to use immoral means to attain moral ends,it is just as wrong,or even more so,to use moral means to preserve immoral ends”#MLK

Chinese govt uses economic threats and intimidation in an effort to compel foreign companies, including American companies, to kowtow to its political line. Foreign companies must understand that the risks of doing business in China are growing, not declining. https://twitter.com/ReutersChina/status/951745889336348672 QT @ReutersChina China demands public apology from Delta for listing Taiwan, Tibet as countries https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-delta/china-demands-public-apology-from-delta-for-listing-taiwan-tibet-as-countries-idUSKBN1F10RC
“We will win our freedom because the sacred heritage of our nation & the eternal will of God are embodied in our echoing demands” #MLKJrDay
“It comes through the tireless efforts and persistent work of men willing to be co-workers with God,” MLK Letter from a Birmingham Jail 2/2
“We must come to see that human progress never rolls in on wheels of inevitability” cont 1/2
But I say to you,love your enemies, and pray for those who persecute you. Matthew 5;44

On #MLKDay, we must recommit ourselves to fighting for the causes that defined his life and work — including voting rights, police and community relations, our criminal justice system, and economic opportunity. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTmEeH0U8AUat1z.jpg
“if you hate your enemies, you have no way to redeem and to transform your enemies.” Dr. Martin Luther King November 17, 1957

To truly honor Dr. King we must fight to carry out his radical and bold vision for racial and economic justice in America and transform our national priorities. The struggle continues to this day, and our work is far from over. #MLKDay
“We have a great dream.It started way back in 1776, and God grant that America will be true to her dream.” #MLKDay2018
“The man who hates can’t think straight;the man who hates can’t reason right;the man who hates can’t see right” 2/2 #MLKDay2018
“Hate distorts the personality.Hate does something to the soul that causes one to lose his objectivity.” #MLK 4th of July 1965 1/2
“not Mexican Americans,not Puerto Rican Americans,but just Americans. One big family of Americans.” 3/3 #MLKDay2018
“Not white Americans,not black Americans,not Jewish or Gentile Americans,not Irish or Italian Americans” 2/3
One day,here in America,I hope... we will become one big family of Americans. #MLK 4th of July 1965 (cont) 1/3
“The American dream reminds us.... that every man is an heir of the legacy of dignity and worth.”  #MLK 4th of July 1965

RT @KamalaHarris My message to activists: I am so proud of you. Keep your chin up and your shoulders back, and stay strong. What you are doing is what inspires me to know that there are better days ahead.
Wishing everyone a happy #MLKDay. "Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?" - Martin Luther King Jr. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTmySueXUAE9bHN.jpg

Through his message of hope, Dr. King inspired millions to fight for justice, seek positive change and stand against oppression. On this #MLKDay, we recommit ourselves to his vision – strengthening our fight for equality for all.

.@CoryBooker joins @32BJSEIU workers and local leaders at Newark Airport for #MLKDay march and rally in support of worker's rights. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTmp_ZQX4AEdzNi.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTmp_ZqXcAEPPNQ.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTmp_Z5W0AE7AFT.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTmp_ZiWkAA7MnR.jpg

Dr. King’s legacy lives through all those who organize for freedom and justice for all. Let his work challenge us to realize our highest ideals. #MLKDay

As Congress moves forward this week on the budget, we must stand with Dreamers. Taking away the legal status of 800,000 young people who were raised in this country and subjecting them to the possibility of deportation would be one of the cruelest acts in modern American history.

RT @SpeakerCoughlin Proud to stand shoulder to shoulder in solidarity with @32BJSEIU @CoryBooker and fellow legislators on #MLKJr Day to urge Newark Airport vendors to pay their employees a fair and living wage. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTmiGTfVQAEKCab.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTmiGTbUQAAVoYh.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTmiGTXVoAEEdGG.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DTmiGTnUQAAzf3u.jpg
Diverse as we are, we have so much more in common than what separates us. This is a moment to remember that, to fight for that, to celebrate that, and to march on.

This fight is especially important now, in this moment when there are so-called leaders who are really sewing hate and division. And, I feel strongly that the spirit of Dr. King’s leadership and legacy is about remembering that we are all in it together.
I’ve recently been reading some of Dr. King’s speeches for inspiration, and really to remind myself that part of what makes us great as a country is the people who fight for the best of who we are.

My best to your daughter in her studies. Thank you for listening to my podcast! https://twitter.com/loongirl23/status/952908897291030528 QT @loongirl23 @CoryBooker @repjohnlewis @ApplePodcasts @Spotify Driving my daughter 5 hours back to college today - this is queued up and ready for us to get on the road!  Thank you both for all your service to our country.

Better times are ahead. Onward.

"Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere. We are caught in an inescapable network of mutuality, tied in a single garment of destiny. Whatever affects one directly, affects all indirectly." —Martin Luther King, Jr. #MLKDay

I am with Héctor J. Figueroa, President of SEIU 32BJ in this video. 

Today he and I joined with hundreds and hundreds of leaders, union members, clergy and more to march for ECONOMIC JUSTICE.

Honoring King’s legacy means joining in the efforts for fair wages and worker dignity. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/953089104320847872/pu/img/xHtFfF0AogueAiIh.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/953089104320847872/pu/vid/320x180/fQ6-_ATSHlxDokwG.mp4

Dr. King’s fight is about understanding we are all equal and saying that we will always fight for that beautiful premise.
